tasks.subject: Study how TypeScript CLI apps are created and tested
Initialize the project
tasks.description: Initialize the project with TypeScript, Rollup, ESLint and Prettier.

tasks.subject: Create a test to test that the app prints it's name with the current version when it is run from the command line
tasks.description: Add and configure jest, create the test using node:child_process.execSync(), and edit pclock.ts so that the test is passed.

tasks.subject: Designing the basic structure of the application a little
tasks.description: Going through and editing the previous README.md.

tasks.subject: A new project timesheet can be created
tasks.description: Create tests for testing that the command 'new' works and edit the code so that the tests are passed. Use the commander library for the implementation and study how the library is used. Previous test for argumentless call had to be rewritten too.

tasks.subject: Clock can be started and stopped
tasks.description:
Create tests for testing the new functionality and edit the code so that the tests are passed.

'Start' command without any arguments creates a new task with current timestamp as 'subject' and 'begin' value. If the task descriptor (regexp matcher) is passed as an argument, a task is created with this string as 'subject' and current timestamp as the 'begin' value. Command exits with an error if the task already exists.

'Stop' command without any arguments stops an active (started but not stopped) task if there is only one of such tasks, by setting the 'end' value of the task to current timestamp. 'Stop' with a task descriptor as argument stops a task with matching 'subject'. If the descriptor matches more than one task, command returns with an error.

tasks.subject: Fix app throwing full errors with stack listings when stopping an already stopped task or a task that hasn't been started
Edit tests testing error conditions so that they test that the error is not thrown with a stack listing
Fix 'start' command claiming that a task has been started when it isn't and add a test for testing this condition
A new project timesheet can be created by starting the clock
Clock can be paused and unpaused
Subject and description of the task can be set and edited
Tasks can be listed and the listing shows time spent on each task
Command 'status' lists started but incomplete tasks and number of complete and incomplete tasks
Tasks can be added without starting the clock
Command 'new' prompts for project name if it is not given as argument
tasks.description: Create tests for testing the new functionality and edit the code so that the tests are passed. Default value for the project name is the name of the parent directory.
